intro: Trautvetteria caroliniensis var. borealis, commonly known as the northern trautvetteria, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts in its native habitat.
